articles.author: Michaela Fallon, Reporter
articles.title: From Sixth Street to Bee Cave: Pecan Street Festival finds new home
articles.description: For the first time in 50 years, the Pecan Street Festival was held outside of downtown Austin, moving to the Hill Country Galleria in Bee Cave on Sept. 13–14. The festival, known for showcasing local artists and small businesses, had been a fixture on Sixth Street since its founding. Organizers announced the move in March 2025 after city plans to reopen weekend traffic on Sixth Street and expand sidewalks for pedestrians left no room for the event. The change also comes after years of frustration among vendors. Many told KUT that downtown parking shortages, limited vendor space and growing...

articles.author: Sun-Times Wire
articles.title: Man fatally shot in Brighton Park
articles.description: An argument apparently sparked a shooting that left a 33-year-old man dead early Monday on the Southwest Side. Luis A. Calderon, 33, was arguing with someone in the 3900 block of South Archer Avenue around 3 a.m. when the person he was arguing with shot him twice in the chest, Chicago police said. Calderon was taken to Mount Sinai Hospital where he was pronounced dead, police said. A weapon was recovered at the scene, officials said. No one was in custody. Area 1 detectives are investigating.

articles.author: Sgt. 1st Class Arturo Guzman
articles.title: 278th ACR Soldiers Complete Obstacle Course at Spur Ride [Image 7 of 12]
articles.description: GRAFENWOEHR TRAINING AREA, Germany — Soldiers assigned to the 278th Armored Cavalry Regiment, Task Force Saber, Joint Multinational Training Group–Ukraine, navigate an obstacle course during the Spur Ride, Oct. 6, 2025. The course simulated combat-related movements such as climbing, crawling, sprinting, and carrying weighted equipment—tasks Soldiers may encounter in operational environments. The Spur Ride honors Cavalry heritage and esprit de corps, challenging Troopers to demonstrate the discipline, teamwork, and proficiency required to earn the coveted silver spurs.

articles.author: Sgt. 1st Class Arturo Guzman
articles.title: 278th ACR Trooper Pushes Through Spur Ride Endurance Challenge [Image 5 of 12]
articles.description: GRAFENWOEHR TRAINING AREA, Germany — A U.S. Army Soldier assigned to the 278th Armored Cavalry Regiment, Task Force Saber, Joint Multinational Training Group–Ukraine, performs a low crawl during a stress shoot as part of the Spur Ride, Oct. 6, 2025. The Spur Ride is a historic Cavalry tradition that tests physical endurance, tactical skill, and mental toughness as Soldiers strive to earn induction into the Order of the Spur.

articles.author: Sgt. 1st Class Arturo Guzman
articles.title: 278th ACR Troopers Complete Classroom Land Navigation Exam During Spur Ride [Image 4 of 12]
articles.description: GRAFENWOEHR TRAINING AREA, Germany — Soldiers assigned to the 278th Armored Cavalry Regiment, Task Force Saber, Joint Multinational Training Group–Ukraine, complete a classroom land navigation exam during the Spur Ride, Oct. 6, 2025. The written portion assessed Troopers’ ability to plot points, read topographic maps, and apply terrain association principles before conducting the practical field test.

articles.author: 1st Lt. Tam Le
articles.title: 278th ACR Soldiers Participate in Spur Ride [Image 2 of 12]
articles.description: GRAFENWOEHR TRAINING AREA, Germany — Soldiers assigned to the 278th Armored Cavalry Regiment, Task Force Saber, Joint Multinational Training Group–Ukraine, participate in the unit’s Spur Ride, Oct. 6, 2025. The Spur Ride is a time-honored Cavalry tradition that challenges Troopers through a series of physically and mentally demanding events, testing their endurance, teamwork, and tactical proficiency to earn induction into the prestigious Order of the Spur.

articles.author: Sgt. 1st Class Arturo Guzman
articles.title: 278th ACR Soldiers Complete Obstacle Course at Spur Ride [Image 11 of 12]
articles.description: GRAFENWOEHR TRAINING AREA, Germany — Soldiers assigned to the 278th Armored Cavalry Regiment, Task Force Saber, Joint Multinational Training Group–Ukraine, navigate an obstacle course during the Spur Ride, Oct. 6, 2025. The course simulated combat-related movements such as climbing, crawling, sprinting, and carrying weighted equipment—tasks Soldiers may encounter in operational environments. The Spur Ride honors Cavalry heritage and esprit de corps, challenging Troopers to demonstrate the discipline, teamwork, and proficiency required to earn the coveted silver spurs.

articles.author: Sgt. 1st Class Arturo Guzman
articles.title: 278th ACR Troopers Conduct Stress Shoot During Spur Ride [Image 10 of 12]
articles.description: GRAFENWOEHR TRAINING AREA, Germany — Soldiers assigned to the 278th Armored Cavalry Regiment, Task Force Saber, Joint Multinational Training Group–Ukraine, conduct a stress shoot during the Spur Ride, Oct. 6, 2025. The event combined physical exertion and precision marksmanship, requiring Troopers to engage multiple targets under simulated combat stress. The stress shoot tested each Soldier’s ability to maintain composure, accuracy, and lethality while fatigued—a key skill in combat readiness and Cavalry tradition.

articles.author: msmash
articles.title: Testing the Viral AI Necklace That Promises Companionship But Delivers Confusion
articles.description: Fortune tested the AI Friend necklace for two weeks and found it struggled to perform its basic function. The $129 pendant missed conversations entirely during the author's breakup call and could only offer vague questions about "fragments" when she tried to ask for advice. The device lagged seven to ten seconds behind her speech and frequently disconnected. The author had to press her lips against the pendant and repeat herself multiple times to get coherent replies. After a week and a half the necklace forgot her name and later misremembered her favorite color. The startup has raised roughly...

articles.title: Auction At Hyd Knowledge City: Land Prices Hit New Record of ₹177 Crore per Acre
articles.description: MSN Realty won the bid after prices rose from the upset price of ₹101 crore per acre. The sale broke the 2022 Neopolis, Kokapet record of ₹100.75 crore per acre, in the auction conducted by HMDA
